Package stocks.model

Interface PortfolioManagementModel

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    PortfolioManagementModelImpl
    public interface PortfolioManagementModel
    Represents a Portfolio Manager for a user. Has the current user's username the current chosen portfolio.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

    • Method Detail

      • getPortfolio

        Portfolio getPortfolio()
        Get the current chosen portfolio for the user.
        Returns:
        Current chosen portfolio for the user.

      • portfolioExists

        boolean portfolioExists​(java.lang.String portfolioName,
                        boolean flexible)
        Check if the portfolio exists in the user account.
        Parameters:
        portfolioName - Name of the portfolio to check.
        flexible - Denotes if the current portfolio chosen is flexible or not.
        Returns:
        true if the portfolio is present in the user account, else returns false.

      • createFlexiblePortfolio

        void createFlexiblePortfolio​(java.lang.String portfolioName)
        Creates a Flexible portfolio with a name and a date of creation.
        Parameters:
        portfolioName - Name of the portfolio which is underscore separated.

      • createInflexiblePortfolio

        void createInflexiblePortfolio​(java.lang.String portfolioName,
                               java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Double> stocks)
        Creates a rigid portfolio with the portfolio name and a list of stock names with their quantity of purchase.
        Parameters:
        portfolioName - name of the portfolio to be created.
        stocks - has a map with the key as the ticker name and value as the ticker quantity.

      • addStock

        void addStock​(java.lang.String ticker,
              double quantity)
        Add a stock to the Flexible portfolio.
        Parameters:
        ticker - Stock ticker.
        quantity - Quantity of the stock the user owns. Should be a positive integer.

      • removeStock

        void removeStock​(java.lang.String ticker,
                 double quantity)
        Removes a stock from Flexible portfolio.
        Parameters:
        ticker - The Stock name which is to be removed.
        quantity - The quantity of the stock that is to be removed.

      • writePortfolioToFile

        void writePortfolioToFile​(java.lang.String portfolioName,
                          boolean flexible)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Writes a portfolio as a xml file.
        Parameters:
        portfolioName - Name of the portfolio as an underscore separated string.
        flexible - Denotes if the current portfolio chosen is flexible or not.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when an unsuccessful file write happens.

      • readFileToPortfolio

        Portfolio readFileToPortfolio​(java.lang.String portfolioName,
                              boolean flexible)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Reads a user's portfolio from the file storage and create a Portfolio object.
        Parameters:
        portfolioName - Name of the portfolio to read.
        flexible - Denotes if the current portfolio chosen is flexible or not.
        Returns:
        Portfolio object of the file read.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when file read is unsuccessful.

      • getPortfolios

        java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.String> getPortfolios​(boolean flexible)
        Retrieves all the user's portfolio names.
        Parameters:
        flexible - Denotes if the current portfolio chosen is flexible or not.
        Returns:
        A list of user's portfolios with portfolio number as the key and portfolio name as the value.

      • validatePortfolio

        boolean validatePortfolio​(Portfolio portfolio)
        Validates a portfolio loaded from an external XML file, if all the stock tickers are supported by the Portfolio manager.
        Parameters:
        portfolio - Portfolio to be validated.
        Returns:
        True if all the stocks in the portfolio are supported. False if one or more stocks in the portfolio is not supported.

      • writeTransactionsToFile

        void writeTransactionsToFile​(java.lang.String portfolioName,
                             java.util.List<TransactionItem> transactions)
        Writes the buy, sell, and commission related transactions on a portfolio to a file.
        Parameters:
        portfolioName - The portfolio name to which the TransactionItem objects belong.
        transactions - The List of TransactionItem objects that are to be written to a file.

      • validateTransaction

        boolean validateTransaction​(java.util.List<TransactionItem> transactions,
                            TransactionItem transaction)
        Performs a buy or a sell operation on the flexible portfolio's stocks based on the transaction line provided as an input.
        Parameters:
        transactions - the list of transactions associated with a portfolio.
        transaction - the transaction that is to be compared to the list of transactions.
        Returns:
        true if the stock quantity is more than 0, returns false if a sell is to be made pre-dates the latest sell on a ticker. Also returns 0 if the quantity is 0 or lesser.

      • getCostBasis

        double getCostBasis​(java.util.List<TransactionItem> transactions,
                    java.lang.String date)
        Provides the cost basis of a portfolio for a given date. It gives the sum of all buys and commissions upto the given date input.
        Parameters:
        transactions - A list of all the transaction lines associated with a portfolio.
        date - The date for when the cost basis is to be calculated.
        Returns:
        a double value which gives the portfolio's cost basis on a given date.

      • constructPortfolioValuation

        java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> constructPortfolioValuation​(java.lang.String date)
                                                                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Get the valuation of the portfolio for a given date.
        Parameters:
        date - Date for which the valuation is calculated.
        Returns:
        2D list of the portfolio valuation with each stock's current value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - when the price data for the ticker doesn't exist.

      • getPortfolioPerformance

        java.util.List<java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Double>> getPortfolioPerformance​(java.lang.String d1,
                                                                                                     java.lang.String d2)
                                                                                              throws java.lang.Exception
        Provides a list that has the valuation of a portfolio over a range of dates. The list size depends on the date range provided as an input. The list size is between 5 and 30(inclusive).
        Parameters:
        d1 - The from-date for evaluating the performance.
        d2 - The to-date for evaluating the performance.
        Returns:
        A list of tuples that stores the date and the portfolio's valuation on that date.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the dates are not given in a valid format.

      • setPortfolioName

        void setPortfolioName​(java.lang.String portfolioName)
        Sets the portfolio name of the currently active portfolio that the user is interacting with.
        Parameters:
        portfolioName - Underscore-separated name of the portfolio.

      • accept

        <T> T accept​(PortfolioOperation operation)
        Perform an operation on the PortfolioManagementModel object. Allows to extend the exisitng functionality of the PortfolioManagementModel class.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of objects that this function returns.
        Parameters:
        operation - Operation object that performs the operation on the PortfolioManagementModel object.
        Returns:
        Returns a value based on the operation performed by the function on the model object.
